content:
The main issue with sbcglobal (AT&T) accounts is that you have to create a secure mail key and enter it in TB when asked for a password.

https://www.att.com/support/article/dsl-high-speed/KM1010523/
creator: sfhowes

content: Yep, iinet do appear to have an issue, and really I am not sure what it is. There are a few other unhappy iinet users on the forum looking for answers at the moment. I think it probably has something to sdo with encrypted connections, but really I have seen nothing concrete. I suggest you try iinets connections settings without SSL or TLS.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
You will need to use the profile manager to register both profiles in Thunderbird. See support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profile-manager-create-and-remove-thunderbird-profiles

Note when I say "register" copy the relevant profile into the profiles folder then use the profile manager to create a new profile, except set it to place the new profile in the location you copies the old profile to.

As shown in the article in this image the path to the profile is shown in the new profile process, but use the choose folder button to set the folder you copied to. Which if the profile is old will probably end in .default, or if newer end in .default-release
creator: MattAuSupport
